title: The Man with the Pipe, Portrait of Dr. Gachet (L'homme Ã  la pipe)
credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Charles J. Rosenbloom
provenance_text:
Vincent van Gogh [1820-1888]; Dr. Paul Gachet [1828-1909], Paris, France; gift to Loys Delteil [1869-1927], until 1927, (L.773) [1]; Estate of Loys Delteil, 1927 until June 1928; (sold at Hotel Drouot [1852-], Paris, Fance, June 13, 1928 until June 15, 1928, no. 279, illustrated) [2]. Charles J. Rosenbloom [1898-1973], Pittsburgh, PA, by 1946, (L.633b) [3]; gift to Museum, December 1967 [3]. 

Notes:
[1]. Given by "Van Ryssel", Dr. Gachet's and his son's pseudonym for signing art. 
[2]. Sale entitled "Catalogue des Estampes Modernes Composant la Collection Loys Delteil, Artiste-Graveur-Expert". 
[3]. Charles Rosenbloom probably purchased the etching from Charles Sessler, Philadelphia, PA in 1937, as suggested by an entry in the Charles Sessler Records, Collection 3205, The Historical Society of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, PA.

Updated by CGK July 2012 and under review for revision.
